sub_title: Vice President, Global Media Relations, Communications Strategy, Planning & Performance Monitoring at Stellantis
summary:
I am a passionate, hands-on and visionary communicator with almost 25 years of market experience and a track record of success in the most diverse and competitive environments – from a regional newspaper in Brazil to Fortune 50 global companies in the United States, Europe and in Latin America. Journalist by trade, all-round public affairs professional by experience, I’m committed to leading high-performance teams and building holistic strategies to help companies stand out from competition through impactful, engaging and vibrant communications.

Key skills and disciplines: 
• Corporate & Brand/Product Communication	 • Multi-Platform Storytelling/Brand Journalism
• Sustainability & Technology Communications	 • Issues Management & Crisis Communications
• People Management & Team Leadership	         • International & Cross-Functional Projects
• Olympic Activations & Sports Marketing	         • Employee engagement & Internal Communications
• Corporate Social Responsibility Strategy	         • Key Stakeholder Engagement Strategies

awards.title: Gold Award - Rio 2016 Olympic Games project
awards.description: Gold Awards are given for work that has broad impact across, teams, plants, work groups or the Company as a whole, creating greater profitability, sustainability and growth. It is work that often takes months to complete, requiring focus, follow-through and a passion for delivering high-quality results. Gold Award recipients are seen consistently as role models. Their work is often substantially innovative, requires courageous leadership and risk taking, and leads to significant internal and external customer satisfaction.

awards.title: Silver Award
awards.description: A Silver Award honors work that may be accomplished outside of the recipient’s normal scope of work. It acknowledges a higher level of effort, impact, or results; including exceeding expectations or goals, being proactive on a project, or contributing directly to the team, plant, work group, or site.  Silver Award recipients look for innovative ways to approach work, reach for challenging goals, balance risk with opportunity, and deliver high-quality results.  At times, Silver-level performance means overcoming significant obstacles or challenges.

profile_positions.description: My role as Global Head of Media Relations and Crisis Management is to command the flow of communication between the Company and the media + key opinion-makers/influencers, building and fostering trust-based and productive relationships with key stakeholders across traditional and online media channels. I also work to establish and implement strategic communications plans; help develop and validate messaging for press releases and pitches, talking points, media statements, etc. Other responsibilities include positioning Company executives as subject matter experts; monitoring and tracking media coverage; organizing media briefings and press conferences; managing crisis communications; media coaching; and serving as official company spokesperson. As Head of Crisis Management, I'm charged with protecting corporate reputation from significant business and corporate crisis by building operational prevention and reaction plans. I'm responsible for providing strategic insights, initiative management, and program analytics to lead Crisis Management response, as well as working with senior levels of management and executive partners across all lines of business to develop innovative solutions to mitigate various types of reputational risks to the company.
profile_positions.title: Vice President, Global Media Relations, Communications Strategy, Planning & Performance Monitoring

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for Corporate Communications, leading multi-faceted strategies aimed at strengthening the corporate reputation of Stellantis LATAM and its leading Brands.

Heading disciplines that work fully integrated and cross-functionally: Media Relations (focused on Corporate matters and Product media); Events (to engage key external and internal stakeholders); Public Relations (as the versatile discipline that brings all others together) and Sustainability (being responsible for managing 100+ community and environmental programs across LATAM that reinforce our license to operate and ensure an efficient management of our operational footprint).

I’m also the president of Casa Fiat de Cultura, an arts & culture institute maintained by Fiat in downtown Belo Horizonte (Minas Gerais) – one of the state’s most prestigious and prominent arts and culture centers. In my first year as president, Casa Fiat has received over 170,000 visitors. It also maintains a year-round prolific education program, hosting students from ages 10-17 from public (mainly) and private local schools for workshops, lectures and guided tours.
profile_positions.title: Corporate Communications & Sustainability Director LATAM | President, Casa Fiat de Cultura

profile_positions.description:
At FCA LATAM, I lead a team of 30+ skilled communicators and sustainability experts located at 5 different sites across Latin America (from Venezuela to Argentina). 
  
My key challenge as LATAM Corporate Communications & Sustainability Director is to rebuild the Corporate Communications functions and lead a multi-faceted strategy aimed at strengthening the corporate reputation of FCA (as a company) and its leading Brands (mainly Fiat, Jeep, Mopar and RAM) before key stakeholders (media, government, communities, academia) in LATAM. 

My functional strategy at FCA is built upon four leading disciplines that work fully integrated and cross-functionally: Media Relations (focused on Corporate matters and Product media); Events (to engage key external and internal stakeholders in FCA’s and its Brands’ key messages); Public Relations (as the versatile discipline that brings all others together) and Sustainability (being responsible for managing 100+ community and environmental programs across LATAM that reinforce our license to operate and ensure an efficient management of our operational footprint).

I’m also the president of Casa Fiat de Cultura, an arts & culture institute maintained by Fiat in downtown Belo Horizonte (Minas Gerais) – one of the state’s most prestigious and prominent arts and culture centers. In my first year as president, Casa Fiat has received over 170,000 visitors. It also maintains a year-round prolific education program, hosting students from ages 10-17 from public (mainly) and private local schools for workshops, lectures and guided tours.
profile_positions.title: Corporate Communications & Sustainability Director - LATAM | President, Casa Fiat de Cultura

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for the overarching corporate and business communications strategies for the Olympic Games and other sports-related activations across regions, functions and business units at Dow - Worldwide Olympic Partner and the Official Chemistry Company of the Olympic Games. 
• Responsible for the development and implementation of the global communications strategy that generated over 2.1 billion media impressions for Dow around the world, highlighting the Company's role as a key enabler of the first Olympic Games in South America.
• Leading up to the Sochi 2014 Olympic Winter Games, developed and implemented a multi-faceted communications strategy that generated over 2,000 media stories highlighting Dow's contributions as the Official Chemistry Company of the Olympic Games, the Official Carbon Partner of Sochi 2014 and technical partner of the Olympic medal-winning USA Luge team (bronze medal for Erin Hamlin). 
• At the London 2012 Olympic Games, led a proactive media relations strategy that reversed initial media bias and generated over 775 positive or neutral stories around the world – with emphasis on the key markets of the United Kingdom, United States, Brazil, Russia and China.
profile_positions.title: Global Communications Manager - Dow Olympic & Sports Solutions

profile_positions.description: Responsible for developing and implementing a global communications strategy across businesses, functions and geographies in order to elevate the Company's reputation and thought-leadership in the key areas of Innovation, Research & Development and STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering & Math) education. profile_positions.title: Global Communications Manager - Innovation/R&D Platform & STEM Education

Led communications for the Styron company divesture in 2010, coordinated the delivery of the Habitat for Humanity program sponsored by Dow in Guarujá, SP (2010) and managed Dow’s activities in Brazil to celebrate the International Year of Chemistry (2011) – among other projects.
